intro: Waltheria ovata, commonly known as the ovalleaf waltheria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its ovate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
